  1 <?php
  2 
  3 namespace UserFrosting;
  4 
  5 /**
  6  * BaseController Class
  7  *
  8  * The base controller class, from which all other controller classes should derive.  Implements some common sitewide routes.
  9  *
 10  * All controller classes require the main application to be injected in via the controller.
 11  * @package UserFrosting
 12  * @author Alex Weissman
 13  * @link http://www.userfrosting.com/navigating/#structure
 14  */
 15 class BaseController {
 16 
 17     /**
 18      * @var UserFrosting The UserFrosting framework application to inject into this controller.
 19      */
 20     protected $_app =         null; 
 21 
 22     /**
 23      * Create a new BaseController object.
 24      *
 25      * @param UserFrosting $app The main UserFrosting app.
 26      */
 27     public function __construct($app){
 28         $this->_app = $app;
 29     }
 30     
 31     /**
 32      * Renders the 404 error page.
 33      *
 34      * This page shows the 404 "page not found" page.
 35      * Request type: GET
 36      */
 37     public function page404(){
 38         $this->_app->render('errors/404.twig');
 39     }
 40 
 41     /**
 42      * Renders the database error page.
 43      *
 44      * This page shows up when there has been an error connecting to the database.
 45      * UserFrosting needs to connect to the database for just about every request.
 46      * Request type: GET
 47      */    
 48     public function pageDatabaseError(){
 49         $this->_app->render('errors/database.twig');
 50     }
 51     
 52     /**
 53      * Render a JS file containing client-side configuration data (paths, etc)
 54      *
 55      * Many client-sided Javascript functions need some basic information about how the site is configured.
 56      * Rather than hard-code it in Javascript, this automatically generates a JS array, called "site",
 57      * which contains this configuration information.
 58      * Request type: GET
 59      */        
 60     public function configJS(){
 61         $this->_app->response->headers->set("Content-Type", "application/javascript");
 62         $this->_app->response->setBody("var site = " . json_encode(
 63             [
 64                 "uri" => [
 65                     "public" => $this->_app->site->uri['public']
 66                 ],
 67                 "debug" => $this->_app->config('debug')
 68             ]
 69         ));
 70     }
 71     
 72     /**
 73      * Selects and renders the CSS for the current user's theme.
 74      *
 75      * Since user themes are configured dynamically, this provides a way for UF to automatically load the appropriate
 76      * CSS file for the current user's theme.
 77      * Request type: GET
 78      * @todo Support for minification
 79      */      
 80     public function themeCSS(){
 81         $this->_app->response->headers->set("Content-Type", "text/css");
 82         $css_include = $this->_app->config('themes.path') . "/" . $this->_app->user->getTheme() . "/css/theme.css";
 83         $this->_app->response->setBody(file_get_contents($css_include));
 84     }    
 85     
 86     /**
 87      * Render the alert stream as a JSON object.
 88      *
 89      * The alert stream contains messages which have been generated by calls to `MessageStream::addMessage` and `MessageStream::addMessageTranslated`.
 90      * Request type: GET
 91      * @see \Fortress\MessageStream
 92      */    
 93     public function alerts(){
 94         if ($this->_app->alerts){
 95             echo json_encode($this->_app->alerts->getAndClearMessages());
 96         }
 97     }
 98     
 99     /**
100      * Generates a new captcha for the user registration form.
101      *
102      * This generates a captcha as a base 64 string, to be placed inside the src attribute of an html image tag.
103      * @author r3wt
104      * @return string The captcha, encoded as a base 64 string.
105      * @todo Move this to the data model!
106      */    
107     public function generateCaptcha(){
108     
109         $md5_hash = md5(rand(0,99999));
110         $security_code = substr($md5_hash, 25, 5);
111         $enc = md5($security_code);
112         // Store the generated captcha to the session
113         $_SESSION['userfrosting']['captcha'] = $enc;
114     
115         $width = 150;
116         $height = 30;
117     
118         $image = imagecreatetruecolor(150, 30);
119     
120         //color pallette
121         $white = imagecolorallocate($image, 255, 255, 255);
122         $black = imagecolorallocate($image, 0, 0, 0);
123         $red = imagecolorallocate($image,255,0,0);
124         $yellow = imagecolorallocate($image, 255, 255, 0);
125         $dark_grey = imagecolorallocate($image, 64,64,64);
126         $blue = imagecolorallocate($image, 0,0,255);
127     
128         //create white rectangle
129         imagefilledrectangle($image,0,0,150,30,$white);
130     
131         //add some lines
132         for($i=0;$i<2;$i++) {
133             imageline($image,0,rand()%10,10,rand()%30,$dark_grey);
134             imageline($image,0,rand()%30,150,rand()%30,$red);
135             imageline($image,0,rand()%30,150,rand()%30,$yellow);
136         }
137 
138         // RandTab color pallette
139         $randc[0] = imagecolorallocate($image, 0, 0, 0);
140         $randc[1] = imagecolorallocate($image,255,0,0);
141         $randc[2] = imagecolorallocate($image, 255, 255, 0);
142         $randc[3] = imagecolorallocate($image, 64,64,64);
143         $randc[4] = imagecolorallocate($image, 0,0,255);
144 
145         //add some dots
146         for($i=0;$i<1000;$i++) {
147             imagesetpixel($image,rand()%200,rand()%50,$randc[rand()%5]);
148         }    
149         
150         //calculate center of text
151         $x = ( 150 - 0 - imagefontwidth( 5 ) * strlen( $security_code ) ) / 2 + 0 + 5;
152     
153         //write string twice
154         imagestring($image,5, $x, 7, $security_code, $black);
155         imagestring($image,5, $x, 7, $security_code, $black);
156         //start ob
157         ob_start();
158         imagepng($image);
159     
160         //get binary image data
161         $data = ob_get_clean();
162         //return base64
163         return 'data:image/png;base64,'.chunk_split(base64_encode($data)); //return the base64 encoded image.
164     }    
165 }
